entities.description: The severity of emotional distress during a two-week period.
Frequency of emotional distress so severe that nothing could cheer the individual up.
Frequency of emotional distress so severe that it interfered with daily activities.
Experiencing additional problems such as changes in sleep, appetite, energy, ability to concentrate, and feelings of low self-worth during periods of distress.

relationships.description: Indicates the severity of emotional distress experienced by the respondent during a two-week period.
Indicates how often the respondent's emotional distress was so severe that nothing could cheer them up.
Indicates how often the respondent's emotional distress interfered with their daily activities.
Indicates whether the respondent experienced additional problems such as changes in sleep, appetite, energy, ability to concentrate, and feelings of low self-worth during periods of distress.
